docTitle.titlePart:
Human herpesvirus 1 miRNA oligo, SEQ ID 8800.
XX KW

front.div:
.
XX PA
(ROSE-) ROSETTA GENOMICS LTD.
XX DR
WPI; 2009-F32128/17.
XX PT
New isolated nucleic acid that is involved in viral infection, useful for
PT manufacturing medicament for treating or preventing viral infection or
PT viral mediated disease condition, e.g. cervical cancer, hepatitis, and
PT influenza, in a subject.
XX PS
Claim 1; SEQ ID NO 8800; 0pp; English.
XX CC
The present invention relates to novel nucleic acid sequences which are
CC involved in viral infection. Also claimed are: a method of preventing or
CC treating viral infection or a condition associated with a viral infection
CC in a subject comprising administering to the subject a composition
CC comprising a nucleic acid sequence selected from AWH60997 -AWH70217,
CC AWH76362 -AWH76388 or AWH76512 -AWH76523; a method of inhibiting
CC expression of a target gene in a cell comprising introducing a nucleic
CC acid into a cell to inhibit expression of the target gene, where the
CC target gene comprises a binding site comprising a sequence selected from
CC AWH70218 -AWH76361 or AWH76389 -AWH76512 and where the nucleic acid is
CC a nucleic acid selected from AWH60997 -AWH70217, AWH76362 -AWH76388 or
CC AWH76512 -AWH76523; a method of detecting viral infection of a cell
CC comprising determining the expression level of at least one nucleic acid
CC sequence selected from AWH60997 -AWH70217, AWH76362 -AWH76388 or
CC AWH76512 -AWH76523; and a method of reducing the amount of virus
CC replication in a target cell, comprising introducing into a target cell
CC infected with the virus an amount of a composition comprising the nucleic
CC acid sequence selected from AWH60997 -AWH70217, AWH76362 -AWH76388 or
CC AWH76512 -AWH76523. The nucleic acid sequences are useful for treating
CC or preventing a viral infection or viral mediated disease condition,
CC where the viral infection is caused by a virus selected from herpes
CC simplex virus (HSV)-1, HSV2, human respiratory syncytial virus (RSV),
CC Epstein Barr-Virus (EBV), Influenza A, hog cholera virus (HCV), human
CC papillomavirus (HPV), HIV, hepatitis B virus (HBV) and Vaccinia virus;
CC inhibiting expression of a target gene in a cell; detecting viral
CC infection of a cell; reducing the amount of virus replication in a target
CC cell; and for treating a viral mediated disease condition in a subject,
CC where the disease condition is selected from Burkitt's lymphoma,
CC nasopharyngeal carcinoma, ovarian carcinoma, cervical cancer, hepatitis,
CC mononucleosis, influenza, genital herpes, encephalitis, and
CC bronchiolitis. Additionally, the nucleic acid is useful for manufacturing
CC a medicament for treating or preventing viral infection.
